xldoc.title: 36 famous theorems in ProofPower
xldoc.description: This page lists the statements of some famous theorems that have been proved in ProofPower.

section.abstract: Freek Wiedijk is tracking progress on automated proofs of a list of "100 greatest theorems". 36 of the theorems on the list have been proved so far in ProofPower. The statements of these theorems are listed below.

subsec.title: 1. The Irrationality of the Square Root of 2
subsec.ft: sqrt_2_irrational_thm &turnstil; ¬Sqrt (&nat;&dsR; 2) ∈ &dsQ;

subsec.title: 3. The Denumerability of the Rational Numbers
subsec.ft: &dsQ;_countable_thm &turnstil; ∃f : &nat; → &dsR;• ∀x• x ∈ &dsQ; ⇒ ∃p•f p = x

subsec.title: 9. The Area of a Circle
subsec.ft: area_circle_thm &turnstil; ∀r• &nat;&dsR; 0 < r ⇒ {(x, y) | Sqrt(x^2 + y^2) ≤ r} Area π * r ^ 2

subsec.title: 11. The Infinitude of Primes
subsec.ft: prime_infinite_thm &turnstil; ¬ Prime ∈ Finite

subsec.title: 15. Fundamental Theorem of Integral Calculus
subsec.ft: int_deriv_thm &turnstil; ∀a b sf f• a < b ∧ (∀x• a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (sf Deriv f x) x) ∧ (sf Cts a) ∧ (sf Cts b) ⇒ (f Int sf b - sf a) (ClosedInterval a b)

subsec.title: 17. De Moivre's Theorem
subsec.ft: de_moivre_thm &turnstil; ∀ x m• (Cos x, Sin x) ^ m = (Cos (&nat;&dsR; m * x), Sin (&nat;&dsR; m * x))

subsec.title: 22. The Non-Denumerability of the Continuum
subsec.ft: &dsR;_uncountable_thm &turnstil; ∀X: &nat; → &dsR;• ∃x• ∀m• ¬x = X m

subsec.title: 25. Schroeder-Bernstein Theorem
subsec.ft: schroeder_bernstein_thm &turnstil; ∀a b f g• f ∈ a ⤚ b ∧ g ∈ b ⤚ a ⇒ ∃h• h ∈ a ⤖ b

subsec.title: 30. The Ballot Problem
subsec.ft: ballot_thm &turnstil; ∀m n• let S = BallotCounts m n in let X = {s | s ∈ S ∧ ∀ i• &nat;&dsZ; 0 < s (i+1)} in S ∈ Finite ∧ ¬#S = 0 ∧ X ⊆ S ∧ (n < m ⇒ #X / #S = (m - n) / (m + n))

subsec.title: 31. Ramsey's Theorem
subsec.ft: fin_exp_2_ramsey_thm &turnstil; ∀a b • ∃n • ∀(V, E) • (V, E) ∈ symg ∧ V ∈ Finite ∧ #V ≥ n ⇒ (∃ C • C clique_of (V,E) ∧ #C = a ∨ C indep_of (V,E) ∧ #C = b)

subsec.title: 34. Divergence of the Harmonic Series
subsec.ft: harmonic_series_divergent_thm &turnstil; ∀c• ¬ Series (λm• &nat;&dsR; (m+1) -1) -> c

subsec.title: 35. Taylor's Theorem
subsec.ft: taylor_thm &turnstil; ∀n f D a b• a < b ∧ D 0 = f ∧ (∀ m x• m ≤ n ∧ a ≤ x ∧ x ≤ b ⇒ D m Cts x) ∧ (∀ m x• m ≤ n ∧ a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (D m Deriv D (m + 1) x) x) ⇒ ∃x• a < x ∧ x < b ∧ f b = PowerSeries (λm• D m a * &nat;&dsR;(m!)-1) (n+1) (b-a) + D (n+1) x * (b-a) ^ (n+1) * &nat;&dsR;((n+1)!)-1

subsec.title: 38. Arithmetic Mean/Geometric Mean
subsec.ft: cauchy_mean_thm &turnstil; ∀A f a• A ∈ Finite ∧ ¬A = {} ∧ (∀ x• x ∈ A ⇒ &nat;&dsR; 0 < f x) ⇒ Root (#A) (Π A f) ≤ Σ A f / &nat;&dsR;(#A)

subsec.title: 40. Minkowski's Fundamental Theorem
subsec.ft: minkowski_thm &turnstil; ∀A a• A ∈ Convex ∧ A ∈ Bounded ∧ ¬A = {} ∧ (∀x y• (x, y) ∈ A ⇒ (~x, ~y) ∈ A) ∧ A Area a ∧ a > &nat;&dsR; 4 ⇒ ∃i j• (&dsZ;&dsR; i, &dsZ;&dsR; j) ∈ A ∧ ¬(&dsZ;&dsR; i, &dsZ;&dsR; j) = (&nat;&dsR; 0, &nat;&dsR; 0)

subsec.title: 42. Sum of the Reciprocals of the Triangular Numbers
subsec.ft: sum_recip_triangulars_thm &turnstil; Series (λm• 2/((m+1)*(m+2))) -> &nat;&dsR; 2

subsec.title: 44. The Binomial Theorem
subsec.ft: binomial_thm &turnstil; ∀x y n• (x + y) ^ n = Series (λm•&nat;&dsR;(Binomial n m) * x ^ m * y ^ (n - m)) (n+1)

subsec.title: 51. Wilson's Theorem
subsec.ft: wilson_thm &turnstil; ∀ p• 1 < p ⇒ (p ∈ Prime ≡ (p - 1)! Mod p = p - 1)

subsec.title: 52. The Number of Subsets of a Set
subsec.ft: ℘_finite_size_thm &turnstil; ∀a• a ∈ Finite ⇒ ℘ a ∈ Finite ∧ #(℘ a) = 2 ^ #a

subsec.title: 58. Formula for the Number of Combinations
subsec.ft: combinations_finite_size_thm &turnstil; ∀A n m• A ∈ Finite ∧ #A = n ⇒ {X | X ⊆ A ∧ #X = m} ∈ Finite ∧ #{X | X ⊆ A ∧ #X = m} = Binomial n m

subsec.title: 63. Cantor's Theorem
subsec.ft: cantor_thm &turnstil; ∀f : 'a → 'a SET• ∃A• ∀x• ¬f x = A

subsec.title: 64. L'Hospital's Rule
subsec.ft: l'hopital_lim_right_thm &turnstil; ∀f df g dg a b c• a < b ∧ f a = &nat;&dsR; 0 ∧ g a = &nat;&dsR; 0 ∧ (∀x•a ≤ x ∧ x < b ⇒ f Cts x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (f Deriv df x) x) ∧ (∀x•a ≤ x ∧ x < b ⇒ g Cts x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (g Deriv dg x) x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ ¬dg x = &nat;&dsR; 0) ∧ ((λx• df x * dg x -1) +#-> c) a ⇒ ((λx• f x * g x -1) +#-> c) a

l'hopital_lim_infinity_thm &turnstil; ∀f df g dg a c• g -+#>+# ∧ (∀x•a < x ⇒ (f Deriv df x) x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ⇒ (g Deriv dg x) x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ⇒ ¬dg x = &nat;&dsR; 0) ∧ (λx• df x * dg x -1) -+#> c ⇒ (λx• f x * g x -1) -+#> c

subsec.title: 66. Sum of a Geometric Series
subsec.ft: geometric_sum_thm &turnstil; ∀n x• ¬x = &nat;&dsR; 1 ⇒ Series (λ m• x ^ m) (n+1) = (&nat;&dsR; 1 - x^(n+1)) / (&nat;&dsR; 1 - x)

subsec.title: 68. Sum of an arithmetic series
subsec.ft: arithmetic_sum_thm &turnstil; ∀c d n• Series (λm• c + &nat;&dsR; m * d) n = 1/2 * &nat;&dsR; n * (&nat;&dsR; 2 * c + (&nat;&dsR; n - &nat;&dsR; 1) * d)

subsec.title: 69. Greatest Common Divisor Algorithm
subsec.ft: euclid_algorithm_thm &turnstil; ∀m n• 0 < m ∧ 0 < n ⇒ Gcd m n = if m < n then Gcd m (n-m) else if m = n then m else Gcd (m-n) n
gcd_def &turnstil; ∀m n• 0 < m ∧ 0 < n ⇒ Gcd m n Divides m ∧ Gcd m n Divides n ∧ (∀d• d Divides m ∧ d Divides n ⇒ d Divides Gcd m n)

subsec.title: 71. Order of a Subgroup
subsec.ft: lagrange_cosets_thm &turnstil; ∀G H• G ∈ Group ∧ Car G ∈ Finite ∧ H ∈ Subgroup G ⇒ Car H ∈ Finite ∧ Car(G/H) ∈ Finite ∧ #G = #H * #(G/H)

subsec.title: 74. The Principle of Mathematical Induction
subsec.ft: induction_thm &turnstil; ∀ p• p 0 ∧ (∀ m• p m ⇒ p (m + 1)) ⇒ (∀ n• p n)

subsec.title: 75. The Mean Value Theorem
subsec.ft: cauchy_mean_value_thm &turnstil; ∀f df g dg a b• a < b ∧ (∀x•a ≤ x ∧ x ≤ b ⇒ f Cts x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (f Deriv df x) x) ∧ (∀x•a ≤ x ∧ x ≤ b ⇒ g Cts x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (g Deriv dg x) x) ⇒ (∃x• a < x ∧ x < b ∧ (dg x)*(f b - f a) = (df x)*(g b - g a))
mean_value_thm &turnstil; ∀f df a b• a < b ∧ (∀x•a ≤ x ∧ x ≤ b ⇒ f Cts x) ∧ (∀x•a < x ∧ x < b ⇒ (f Deriv df x) x) ⇒ (∃x•a < x ∧ x < b ∧ f b - f a = (b - a) * df x)

subsec.title: 79. The Intermediate Value Theorem
subsec.ft: intermediate_value_thm &turnstil; ∀f a b• a < b ∧ (∀x•a ≤ x ∧ x ≤ b ⇒ f Cts x) ⇒ (∀y• (f a < y ∧ y < f b ∨ f b < y ∧ y < f a) ⇒ ∃x• a < x ∧ x < b ∧ f x = y)

subsec.title: 80. The Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
subsec.ft: unique_factorisation_thm &turnstil; ∀m• 0 < m ⇒ ∃1 e• {k | ¬e k = 0} ∈ Finite ∧ {k | ¬e k = 0} ⊆ Prime ∧ m = Π {k | ¬e k = 0} (λp• p ^ e p)

subsec.title: 81. Divergence of the Prime Reciprocal Series
subsec.ft: recip_primes_div_thm &turnstil; (∀n•{p | p ∈ Prime ∧ p ≤ n} ∈ Finite) ∧ (∀m•∃n• &nat;&dsR; m ≤ Σ {p | p ∈ Prime ∧ p ≤ n} (λp• &nat;&dsR; p -1))

subsec.title: 85. Divisibility by 3 Rule
subsec.ft: div_3_rule_thm &turnstil; ∀digits n• 3 Divides Σ {i | i < n} (λi•digits i * 10 ^ i) ≡ 3 Divides Σ {i | i < n} (λi•digits i)

subsec.title: 89. The Factor and Remainder Theorems
subsec.ft: poly_factor_thm &turnstil; ∀l1 c• ¬l1 = [] ∧ PolyEval l1 c = &nat;&dsR; 0 ⇒ ∃l2• Length l2 < Length l1 ∧ (λx• PolyEval l1 x) = (λx• (x - c)*PolyEval l2 x)
poly_remainder_thm &turnstil; ∀l1 c• ¬l1 = [] ⇒ ∃l2• Length l2 < Length l1 ∧ (λx• PolyEval l1 x) = (λx• (x - c)*PolyEval l2 x + PolyEval l1 c)

subsec.title: 91. The Triangle Inequality
subsec.ft: triangle_inequality_thm &turnstil; ∀f g• {x | ¬f x = &nat;&dsR; 0} ∈ Finite ∧ {x | ¬g x = &nat;&dsR; 0} ∈ Finite ⇒ {x | ¬f x + g x = &nat;&dsR; 0} ∈ Finite ∧ Norm (λ x• f x + g x) ≤ Norm f + Norm g

subsec.title: 93. The Birthday Problem
96. Principle of Inclusion/Exclusion
subsec.ft: size_inc_exc_thm &turnstil; ∀I U A• I ∈ Finite ∧ ¬I = {} ∧ (∀i• i ∈ I ⇒ U i ∈ Finite) ∧ A = &lcup;{B | ∃i• i ∈ I ∧ B = U i} ⇒ &nat;&dsR;(# A) = Σ (℘I \ {{}}) (λJ• ~(&nat;&dsR; 1) ^ (#J + 1) * &nat;&dsR;(# (&lcap;{B | ∃j• j ∈ J ∧ B = U j})))

buffon_needle_thm &turnstil; let S = {(θ, d) | θ ∈ ClosedInterval (&nat;&dsR; 0) π ∧ d ∈ ClosedInterval (&nat;&dsR; 0) (&nat;&dsR; 1)} in let x_axis = {(x, y) | y = &nat;&dsR; 0} in let needle(θ, d) = {(x, y) | ∃t• t ∈ ClosedInterval (&nat;&dsR; 0) (&nat;&dsR; 1) ∧ x = t * Cos θ ∧ y = d - t * Sin θ} in let X = {(θ, d) | (θ, d) ∈ S ∧ ¬needle(θ, d) ∩ x_axis = {}} in X ⊆ S ∧ ∃x s• ¬s = &nat;&dsR; 0 ∧ X Area x ∧ S Area s ∧ x / s = &nat;&dsR; 2 / π
